section.title: Neutron: Delete your network or subnet
section.para: If you no longer need your network, or subnet, you can delete it.
To delete a network, specify the network ID. To delete a subnet, specify the subnet ID.

sidebar.para:
Next step: Choose one of the following methods:
“Delete a network or subnet with the neutron client”
“Delete a network or subnet with cURL”

section.title: Delete a network or subnet with the neutron client

step.title: Delete the network
step.para:
Issue the following neutron client command:
$ neutron net-delete <id>

listitem.para: The network ID of the network that you want to delete. To determine the network ID, issue a neutron net-list command.

step.title: Delete the subnet
step.para:
Issue the following neutron client command:
$ neutron subnet-delete <id>

listitem.para: The subnet ID of the subnet that you want to delete. To determine the subnet ID, issue a neutron subnet-list command.

section.title: Delete a network or subnet with cURL

step.title: Delete the network
step.para:
Issue the following cURL command:
$ curl -i https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/$account/networks/{id} \ -X 'DELETE' \ -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" \ -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: $account" \ -H "Accept: application/json"

note.para: Include the -i option in the cURL command to show the response header. Omit the | python -m json.tool clause from the command because the API operation does not return a JSON response.

listitem.para: id. The network ID of the network that you want to delete. To determine the network ID, issue a nova network-list command.

step.para: Successful deletion returns an Accepted (202) response code:

screen.computeroutput:
HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted Date: Thu, 04 Oct 2012 16:23:30 GMT Content-Length: 58 Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8 Server: Jetty(8.0.y.z-SNAPSHOT)
202 Accepted
The request is accepted for processing.

step.title: Delete the subnet
step.para:
Issue the following cURL command:
$ curl -i https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/$account/subnets/{id} \ -X 'DELETE' \ -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" \ -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: $account" \ -H "Accept: application/json"

note.para: Include the -i option in the cURL command to show the response header. Omit the | python -m json.tool clause from the command because the API operation does not return a JSON response.

listitem.para: id. The subnet ID of the subnet that you want to delete. To determine the network ID, issue a nova network-list command.
